info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:52PM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches possible above 4000 feet with localized amounts up to 16 inches on the lower sections of Mt. Shasta around 6500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Elevations about 4000 feet in South Central Siskiyou County and North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County. This includes Dead Horse Summit and Snowmans Summit on Highway 89. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
